comment.text:
Some websites fail loading with `NET::ERR_CERTIFICATE_TRANSPARENCY_REQUIRED`. Examples are https://duckduckgo.com/ and https://www.bloomberg.com/. 
They work both with the Firefox 68.0.2 and Google Chrome 76.0.3809.132
Same issue `NET::ERR_CERTIFICATE_TRANSPARENCY_REQUIRED`. chromium-vaapi works fine.
LGTM

Both the chromium-76.0.3809.100-1.fc30 and chromium-76.0.3809.132-1.fc30 builds have a number of issues with NET::ERR_CERTIFICATE_TRANSPARENCY_REQUIRED erros, refusing to load for example www.google.com.
Rolling back to chromium-75.0.3770.100-3.fc30 resolves these issues.

The same issue with  NET::ERR_CERTIFICATE_TRANSPARENCY_REQUIRED as in f30. Downgrade to 75.0.3770.100-3.fc29 solves the problems.

 https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2019-5d2420030c
Same issue NET::ERR_CERTIFICATE_TRANSPARENCY_REQUIRED, e.g. gist.github.com
As vvvelichkov mentioned, I'm getting the certificate error as well
Build chromium-76.0.3809.132-2.fc30 appears to have resolved the NET::ERR_CERTIFICATE_TRANSPARENCY_REQUIRED errors.
LGTM with this new update
Seems fine now.
Problem with NET::ERR_CERTIFICATE_TRANSPARENCY_REQUIRED seems to be resolved.

bugs.title: CVE-2019-5847 chromium: chromium-browser: V8 sealed/frozen elements cause crash [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-5847 chromium: chromium-browser: V8 sealed/frozen elements cause crash [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2019-5847 chromium-browser: V8 sealed/frozen elements cause crash

long_desc.thetext:
The following flaw was identified in the Chromium browser: V8 sealed/frozen elements cause crash.

Upstream bug(s):

https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=972921

External References:

https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2019/07/stable-channel-update-for-desktop.html

Created chromium tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 1731350]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1731349]

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 Supplementary

Via RHSA-2019:1930 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:1930

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2019-5847

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=high

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1731071,1731349

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

comment.text:
Some websites fail loading with `NET::ERR_CERTIFICATE_TRANSPARENCY_REQUIRED`. Examples are https://duckduckgo.com/ and https://www.bloomberg.com/. 
They work both with the Firefox 68.0.2 and Google Chrome 76.0.3809.132
Same issue `NET::ERR_CERTIFICATE_TRANSPARENCY_REQUIRED`. chromium-vaapi works fine.
LGTM

Both the chromium-76.0.3809.100-1.fc30 and chromium-76.0.3809.132-1.fc30 builds have a number of issues with NET::ERR_CERTIFICATE_TRANSPARENCY_REQUIRED erros, refusing to load for example www.google.com.
Rolling back to chromium-75.0.3770.100-3.fc30 resolves these issues.

The same issue with  NET::ERR_CERTIFICATE_TRANSPARENCY_REQUIRED as in f30. Downgrade to 75.0.3770.100-3.fc29 solves the problems.

 https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2019-5d2420030c
Same issue NET::ERR_CERTIFICATE_TRANSPARENCY_REQUIRED, e.g. gist.github.com
As vvvelichkov mentioned, I'm getting the certificate error as well
Build chromium-76.0.3809.132-2.fc30 appears to have resolved the NET::ERR_CERTIFICATE_TRANSPARENCY_REQUIRED errors.
LGTM with this new update
Seems fine now.
Problem with NET::ERR_CERTIFICATE_TRANSPARENCY_REQUIRED seems to be resolved.

https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=951525

External References:

https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2019/07/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_30.html

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 Supplementary

Via RHSA-2019:2427 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:2427

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2019-5861

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=low

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1735496,1735498

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

bug.title: CVE-2019-5847 chromium: chromium-browser: V8 sealed/frozen elements cause crash [fedora-all]
CVE-2019-5848 chromium: chromium-browser: Font sizes may expose sensitive information [fedora-all]

comments.text:
Some websites fail loading with `NET::ERR_CERTIFICATE_TRANSPARENCY_REQUIRED`. Examples are https://duckduckgo.com/ and https://www.bloomberg.com/. 
They work both with the Firefox 68.0.2 and Google Chrome 76.0.3809.132

bug.title: CVE-2019-5847 chromium: chromium-browser: V8 sealed/frozen elements cause crash [fedora-all]
CVE-2019-5848 chromium: chromium-browser: Font sizes may expose sensitive information [fedora-all]

comments.text: Same issue `NET::ERR_CERTIFICATE_TRANSPARENCY_REQUIRED`. chromium-vaapi works fine.

bug.title: CVE-2019-5847 chromium: chromium-browser: V8 sealed/frozen elements cause crash [fedora-all]
CVE-2019-5848 chromium: chromium-browser: Font sizes may expose sensitive information [fedora-all]

comments.text:
Both the chromium-76.0.3809.100-1.fc30 and chromium-76.0.3809.132-1.fc30 builds have a number of issues with NET::ERR_CERTIFICATE_TRANSPARENCY_REQUIRED erros, refusing to load for example www.google.com.
Rolling back to chromium-75.0.3770.100-3.fc30 resolves these issues.
This update has been obsoleted.
